metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2318 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.23 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a crafted SVG file, related to the (1) DrawImage function in magick/render.c, (2) SVGStartElement function in coders/svg.c, and (3) TraceArcPath function in magick/render.c. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.23-1ubuntu0.1').
